intro: Cyrtandra bullata, commonly known as the white-flowered cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically borne on slender stems. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra bullata is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
